title: Slate magazine logotype
content:
Hello Typophile,

I’m looking around trying to find what Slate magazine uses as their logotype, and I’m having no luck. I thought I’d post it here. Any ideas?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070809002219im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1.gif)

 [‹ (x) Marc Jacobs website type - Engravers Gothic {Nick](http://web.archive.org/web/20070809002219/http:/typophile.com/node/15932 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Beyond Swiss Tradition" Zurich Jazz Orchestra - Arbiter BQ {Claes Kallarsson} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070809002219/http:/typophile.com/node/19412 "Go to next forum topic")
author: eston

comments.content: Isn’t it [Bernhard Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20070809002219/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/bernhard-gothic/)? I don’t have a copy here so I”m guessing.
I don’t think that is the image which you intend for us to view.

Uh, I don’t know what Typophile just did. That’s not my image (and that’s Eurostile.)

[http://img179.imageshack.us/img179/1676/untitled15nk.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20070809002219/http:/img179.imageshack.us/img179/1676/untitled15nk.gif "http://img179.imageshack.us/img179/1676/untitled15nk.gif")

EDIT: Wow, totally beaten on my own post. Yes, the one that you have, Stephen.
Hmm. I was wrong. Closer still would be [Kabel](http://web.archive.org/web/20070809002219/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/kabel/), but this is still not perfect.
At first glance I was thinking Kabel too, but I knew that it wasn’t right. It’s probably a custom face of some sort, but Canterbury Sans is on the right track...

<cite>Canterbury Sans, not a match</cite>

I love MyFonts, but I have never clicked that “More fonts like this” link, where the results were useful in the least.
